Module simplifier
Package ie.gmit.dip

Class ConfigurableAnsiColorCodeMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • ie.gmit.dip.ConfigurableAnsiColorCodeMap
  • public class ConfigurableAnsiColorCodeMap
extends java.lang.Object
    ConfigurableAnsiColorCodeMap is a simple class which allows the user to define, control, and extend the colors used for printing text to a terminal/console window. It is coupled to and highly cohesive with the abstract functional interface defined by DefaultAnsiColorCodeMap, and relies heavily on, and delegates most functionality to the HashMap class of the java Collections framework.
    Since:
    JavaSE-11
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kieran P. Somers
    See Also:
    DefaultAnsiColorCodeMap

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ConfigurableAnsiColorCodeMap()
      Constructor method which initializes the color map with default values via the DefaultAnsiColorCodeMap.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConfigurableAnsiColorCodeMap

        public ConfigurableAnsiColorCodeMap()
        Constructor method which initializes the color map with default values via the DefaultAnsiColorCodeMap. Method has O(c) running time locally.
        See Also:
        DefaultAnsiColorCodeMap

    • Method Detail

      • getColorMap

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> getColorMap()
        Getter method which returns the color map as a HashMap of String types. Method has O(n) running time due to manual deep copy of the HashMap.
        Returns:
        colorMap a copy of the the HashMap of colors where keys are String types and values are corresponding ANSI codes defined as String types.

      • setColorMap

        public void setColorMap​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> colorMap)
        Setter method to set the color map in its entirety. O(n) running time where n is the number of keys in the input colorMap.
        Parameters:
        colorMap - a HashMap of color names and corresponding ANSI codes.

      • getColors

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getColors()
        Getter method which allows the user to get a ArrayList of color keys in a sorted format. The colors are sorted via the Collections framework's in-built sort method using the default compareTo method of String. This method has O(n*log(n)) running time as is the case for the Collections.sort() method.
        Returns:
        a sorted ArrayList of String types defining various colors by name.

      • containsColor

        public boolean containsColor​(java.lang.String color)
        Method to test whether the map already contains a color. Running time is O(1) or O(c) as is the case for the containsKey() method of HashMap.
        Parameters:
        color - a String type defining the name of a color.
        Returns:
        boolean true or false depending on whether color is in HashMap.

      • getAnsiCode

        public java.lang.String getAnsiCode​(java.lang.String color)
        Method to get the ansi code of a given color Running time is O(1) or O(c) as is the case for the containsKey() and get() methods of HashMap.
        Parameters:
        color - a String type defining the color whose ANSI code is required.
        Returns:
        String a String type with the ANSI code, or a null String if absent.

      • addColorCode

        public boolean addColorCode​(java.lang.String color,
                            java.lang.String ansi)
        Method which allows the user to add a color and its ANSI code to the map. The contains and add methods of HashMap are all O(1) or O(c) and by extension this method has the same performance.
        Parameters:
        color - a String type defining the color to be added.
        ansi - a String type defining the ANSI color code of the color to be added.
        Returns:
        boolean true if added, false if not added.
